sect1.title: Installing kdebase

para.screen: Download location (FTP): Estimated build disk space: 132 MB Estimated installed space: 45 MB Package size: &kde-base-size; Estimated build time: 98 min (667 MHz)

sect1.para: kdebase can use many optional libraries and programs. The following are recommended: , , , , shadow (in the LFS book), and cups.
Other programs and libraries that can be used by kdebase are: lame, and pam
Check to see if /lib/libmisc.la exists. If not, run: ln -sf /usr/lib/libmisc.la /lib/libmisc.la
Install kdebase with: ./configure --prefix=&kde-dir; --disable-debug \ --disable-dependency-tracking --disable-lametest --with-shadow && make && make install

sect2.title: kdebase Installation Commmand explanations
sect2.para: --disable-lametest: Do not search for and use lame support. This package provides mp3 encoding. See for information about this package.

listitem.para: kdesktop - the program that handles desktop icons, popup menus, and the screensaver system.
kappfinder - utility to add non-KDE applications to K-menu
kdm - KDE Display manager (a replacement for xdm
khotkeys - handles hot keys for KDE
kmenuedit - utility to reaggange or add to the K-menu
konqueror - a filesystem and Web browser
konsole - a highly configurable X terminal emulator
kscreensaver - program to set up screensavers
ktip - wizard to provide hints and KDE information
